page.title: 16CHURCHES AND PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: {CHURCHES}The three Anglican churches in the area now come under one rector. The three churches are at Ashwick, Binegar and Oakhill. Recently the large vicerage at Ashwick was sold and the rector moved to a more managable house in Oakhill. At present the church at Oakhill is under threat of closure due to the need for expensive repairs, but villagers are fighting the issue. The only non conformist church remaining is the Methodist Chapel in Oakhill, the old United Reform Chapel has recently been converted into two houses. {PUBLIC HOUSES}Of the 4 inns in the area, the George Inn & the Mendip Inn began as coaching inns while The Horse and Jockey began when the railway was built. The Oakhill Inn served a large working population. They are still village inns attracting passing trade.
